title: Le GNL russe repr√©sente un quart des importations de gaz espagnoles en mars
cleaned_sentences: Liquefied natural gas (LNG) from Russia represented almost 26 % of Spain gas imports in March, against 14.4 % a year earlier, which confirms that the Iberian country is an essential hub for the delivery of Russian gas to Europe.
Data from the Spanish operator Enagas showed on Wednesday that Russia was the country's second gas supplier last month after Algeria.
LNG deliveries represented 65.5 % of Spanish imports, the rest being sent by gas pipeline.

Thanks to the greatest number of European Union import terminals, Spain has become Spain has become the first Russian gas re-exporter transported by sea, which represented 23 % of all Spanish gas imports in January-March.
Spain's natural gas imports fell 23.2 % in the month compared to the same month of the previous year, which corresponds to 29,129 gigawatt hours, Enagas said in a statement.
Total gas imports from Algeria represented 42 %.
Spain's storage facilities were 81% at the end of March.

In March, the Spanish Minister of Energy, Teresa Ribera, called on the European Commission to adopt a common approach to ban Russian gas, including maritime LNG, following the invasion of Ukraine by Russia in 2022.
Lithuania had declared The EU should include in the law its Ukraine abandonment project by 2027.
Nevertheless, the oil and gas revenues of Russia, which represent approximately a third of total budgetary revenue, increased by 90 %, increased by 90 % Last month compared to March 2023.
